<p>Nintendo gear is always sought after during the holiday shopping season, but this year likely more so than others. The <a data-i13n="cpos:1;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/nintendo-switch-2-review-more-of-what-you-love-120048430.html">Nintendo Switch 2</a> is <em>the</em> console launch of 2025 and it will undoubtedly be at the top of many wish lists for both kids and adults alike. If you were hoping to save a bit on the console during the <a data-i13n="cpos:2;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/deals/black-friday-deals-for-2025-are-here-early-we-found-the-best-sales-from-apple-amazon-lego-dyson-and-more-100052430.html">Black Friday</a> shopping season, you may be disappointed. The Nintendo Black Friday sale was just <a data-i13n="cpos:3;pos:1" href="https://www.nintendo.com/us/whatsnew/nintendo-announces-holiday-offers-for-black-friday-and-cyber-monday-2025/">announced</a>, and unsurprisingly, there aren&#39;t a lot of true &quot;deals&quot; to be had. This is typical of Nintendo — legit Nintendo Black Friday deals are hard to come by — but there are ways to at least get the best value for your money if you&#39;re going to pick up a Switch 2 before the year is out.</p> 
<p>As has been the case for many years, the marquee Nintendo deals for the holidays come in the form of console bundles. When the Switch 2 launched earlier this year, it was available as just the <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:4;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0F3GWXLTS&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=11936ab9-2878-4c46-a6cc-e53399939fde&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=console+only&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAYHBQAdHncRZUFbEpWxUOHtjyDqpm7RgA2DGIHGoJwva&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FNintendo-Switch-2-System%2Fdp%2FB0F3GWXLTS" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/Nintendo-Switch-2-System/dp/B0F3GWXLTS">console only</a> for $449 or <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:5;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0FC5FJZ9Z&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=11936ab9-2878-4c46-a6cc-e53399939fde&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=bundled+with+Mario+Kart+World+for+%24499&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAbQpAR5btsaKVS0LipKyLeAYQgyW3KnWsl7dbLbiKt61&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FNintendo-Switch-Mario-World-Bundle-2%2Fdp%2FB0FC5FJZ9Z%2F" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/Nintendo-Switch-Mario-World-Bundle-2/dp/B0FC5FJZ9Z/">bundled with <em>Mario Kart World</em> for $499</a>. Both options are still available now. Considering the games by themselves cost $70 each, you do save a bit by picking up a console bundle. you can pick up the console and its bundles at most retailers including <a <h3 id="jump-link-nintendo-switch-game-deals">Nintendo Switch game deals</h3> 
<p>When it comes to deals on Nintendo Switch 2 games, the <a data-i13n="cpos:9;pos:1" href="https://www.nintendo.com/au/hardware/nintendo-switch-2/featured-games/">Nintendo eShop</a> will have Cyber Deals starting on November 20, running through December 3. The shop will feature &quot;holiday offers on select games,&quot; so it appears we&#39;ll all just have to go to the online store on November 20 to see the games on offer.</p>

<h3 id="jump-link-nintendo-switch-accessory-deals">Nintendo Switch accessory deals</h3>

<h3 id="jump-link-more-nintendo-black-friday-deals">More Nintendo Black Friday deals</h3> 
<p>Even if you can&#39;t get huge discounts on Nintendo consoles or new games this year, that doesn&#39;t mean you can&#39;t find decent deals on other Nintendo gear. There are plenty of great ideas for <a data-i13n="cpos:43;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/the-best-nintendo-gifts-for-the-2025-holiday-season-110057620.html">gifts for the Nintendo fan in your life</a>, and Engadget&#39;s Sam Rutherford got to see a bunch of them in person when he attended Nintendo&#39;s holiday showcase. From collectibles to clothing to plushies and holiday decor, there&#39;s really a ton to choose from — but you may want to pace yourself if you&#39;re also a Nintendo fan finding things that you want to pick up for yourself in the process of looking for good gifts. Here are just some of the best Nintendo gift ideas that you can look out for during Black Friday and Cyber Monday.</p> 
<p>
